gil.common
Class ConfigFile

java.lang.Object
  gil.common.ConfigFile

public class ConfigFile
extends java.lang.Object

Parses a xml configuration file with the following format: appSetting is mandatory. Additional free format sections and properties sections are not.

Constructor Summary
protected ConfigFile(org.w3c.dom.Document xmlDoc, java.lang.String filename)

          Returns a Map of settings for the properties section with the given name.

          Returns a xml element for the free format section with the given name.

read

public static ConfigFile read(java.lang.String filename)
                       throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                              org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                              java.io.IOException
Reads the xml configuration file with the given name and constructs a ConfigFile object.

Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException

getPropertiesSection

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getPropertiesSection(java.lang.String name)
                                                                      throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException,
                                                                             InvalidFileFormatException
Returns a Map of settings for the properties section with the given name. An InvalidFileFormatException is thrown if the requested section does not exist or if multiple sections exists with the same name.

Throws:
javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
InvalidFileFormatException

getSection

public org.w3c.dom.Element getSection(java.lang.String name)
                               throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException,
                                      InvalidFileFormatException
Returns a xml element for the free format section with the given name. Further xml parsing of the returned element is done by the caller. A InvalidFileFormatException is thrown if the requested section does not exist or the section exists more than once.

Throws:
javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
InvalidFileFormatException

getAppSetting

public java.lang.String getAppSetting(java.lang.String name)
                               throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException,
                                      InvalidFileFormatException
Returns the setting with the given name in the mandatory "appSettings" section. If a setting with the name does not exist a InvalidFileFormatException is thrown.

Throws:
javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
InvalidFileFormatException

sectionExists

public boolean sectionExists(java.lang.String name)
                      throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
Throws:
javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
